questions.question_text: The constant of the cone of a Lambert's chart is 0.75. The angle between the meridian of 30°E and the straight line on the chart from A (30°E, 50°N) to position B is 120° (measure clockwise from the meridian). What is the rhumb line track from A to B?

The constant of the cone of a Lambert's chart is 0.75. The angle between the meridian of 30°E and the straight line on the chart from A (30°E, 50°N) to position B is 120° (measure clockwise from the meridian). What is the final great circle track from A to B?
